title: Rainbow cloud spotted in the Philippines
title_page: Rainbow cloud spotted in the Philippines | Daily Mail Online
text:
This stunning rainbow cloud was captured on Sunday and appears to resemble a unicorn.
Anne Salikala, 21, spotted the incredible shimmering clouds in the sky in Pagadian City, Philippines.
The unique formation looks like the multicoloured flowing mane of the mythological horned creature.
Scroll down for video:
Posted by a resident of Pagadian City in the Philippines showing clouds surrounded by a rainbow - in a phenomenon called 'cloud iridescence'
Anne, who is a nurse, said she recorded the 'unicorn rainbow' at around 3pm but it disappeared quickly after.
She said: 'When I saw it I just thought that it looked like a unicorn, so I called it a unicorn cloud. It looks like a unicorn is coming.'
'It was amazing. It looked like a magical kind of phenomenon. I've never seen anything like it before.'
Anne Salikala, 21, spotted the rare rainbow cloud phenomenon. She thought it looked like a unicorn. 'I've never seen anything like it before'
'It wasn't in the sky for long. So I was lucky to be able to record it. Certainly, it has made a lot of people happy to look at it.'
The stunning rainbow is believed to have formed from a combination of the humidity, heat, and tiny droplets of water suspended around the cloud.
Such 'cloud iridescence' happens when tiny frozen water droplets in the clouds are hit by sunlight at just the right angle to form a rainbow of colors.
The phenomenon is called cloud iridescence or irisation. The term comes from Iris, the Greek personification of rainbow.
Cloud iridescence is a fairly uncommon phenomenon.
